columns.StayID: The unique identifier for each hospital stay.
columns.Patient: The unique identifier for the patient receiving care.
columns.Room: The room number where the patient is housed.
columns.StayStart: The date and time when the hospital stay begins.
columns.StayEnd: The date and time when the hospital stay ends.

Stay.table_description: The table tracks patient stays, including start and end dates.

columns.Patient: The unique identifier for the patient undergoing a procedure.
columns.Procedures: The procedure code associated with the patientâ€™s treatment.
columns.Stay: The unique identifier for the hospital stay linked to the procedure.
columns.DateUndergoes: The date and time when the procedure is performed.
columns.Physician: The unique identifier for the physician performing the procedure.
columns.AssistingNurse: The unique identifier for the nurse assisting with the procedure.

Undergoes.table_description: The table records details of procedures performed on patients.

columns.Nurse: The unique identifier for the nurse on call.
columns.BlockFloor: The floor number of the block where the nurse is assigned.
columns.BlockCode: The unique code for the specific block assigned to the nurse.
columns.OnCallStart: The date and time when the nurse's on-call period begins.
columns.OnCallEnd: The date and time when the nurse's on-call period ends.

On_Call.table_description: The table logs on-call shifts for nurses in various blocks.

columns.Code: The unique identifier for each medication.
columns.Name: The name of the medication.
columns.Brand: The brand name associated with the medication.
columns.Description: The brief description of the medication.

Medication.table_description: The table records medications with their identifiers, names, and brands.

columns.Physician: The unique identifier for the physician prescribing medication.
columns.Patient: The unique identifier for the patient receiving the medication.
columns.Medication: The unique identifier for the prescribed medication.
columns.Date: The date and time when the medication is prescribed.
columns.Appointment: The unique identifier for the appointment linked to the prescription.
columns.Dose: The amount of medication prescribed to the patient.

Prescribes.table_description: The table records medication prescriptions for patients by physicians.

columns.DepartmentID: The unique identifier for each department in the hospital.
columns.Name: The name of the department, such as Surgery or Psychiatry.
columns.Head: The unique identifier for the physician heading the department.

Department.table_description: The table records departments with their identifiers, names, and heads.

columns.EmployeeID: The unique identifier for each physician in the hospital.
columns.Name: The full name of the physician.
columns.Position: The job title of the physician within the hospital.
columns.SSN: The social security number of the physician.

Physician.table_description: The table records physician details including identifiers, names, positions, and SSNs.

columns.BlockFloor: The unique floor number of the hospital block.
columns.BlockCode: The unique code identifying the specific hospital block.

Block.table_description: The table records the blocks in the hospital by floor and code.

columns.RoomNumber: The unique identifier for each hospital room.
columns.RoomType: The type of the room, such as Single or Double.
columns.BlockFloor: The floor number of the block where the room is located.
columns.BlockCode: The unique code identifying the specific block of the room.
columns.Unavailable: Indicates whether the room is currently unavailable for use.

Room.table_description: The table records rooms with their types, locations, and availability status.

columns.Physician: The unique identifier for each physician affiliated with a department.
columns.Department: The unique identifier for the department affiliated with the physician.
columns.PrimaryAffiliation: Indicates whether the physician has primary affiliation with the department.

Affiliated_With.table_description: The table records affiliations between physicians and their respective departments.

columns.Code: The unique identifier for each medical procedure.
columns.Name: The name of the medical procedure being performed.
columns.Cost: The financial cost associated with each medical procedure.

Procedures.table_description: The table lists medical procedures along with their identifiers, names, and costs.

columns.Physician: The unique identifier for the physician with training.
columns.Treatment: The unique identifier for the treatment associated with training.
columns.CertificationDate: The date when the physician's training certification is issued.
columns.CertificationExpires: The expiration date of the physician's training certification.

Trained_In.table_description: The table records training details of physicians for specific treatments.

columns.SSN: The unique identifier for each patient.
columns.Name: The full name of the patient.
columns.Address: The residential address of the patient.
columns.Phone: The contact phone number of the patient.
columns.InsuranceID: The unique identifier for the patient's insurance policy.
columns.PCP: The unique identifier for the patient's primary care physician.

Patient.table_description: The table records patient details, including contact and insurance information.

columns.EmployeeID: The unique identifier for each nurse in the hospital.
columns.Name: The full name of the nurse.
columns.Position: The job title of the nurse within the hospital.
columns.Registered: Indicates whether the nurse is registered to practice.
columns.SSN: The social security number of the nurse.

Nurse.table_description: The table records details of nurses, including identifiers and registration status.

columns.AppointmentID: The unique identifier for each appointment scheduled.
columns.Patient: The unique identifier for the patient attending the appointment.
columns.PrepNurse: The unique identifier for the nurse preparing the patient.
columns.Physician: The unique identifier for the physician conducting the appointment.
columns.Start: The date and time when the appointment begins.
columns.End: The date and time when the appointment concludes.
columns.ExaminationRoom: The designated room for conducting the appointment.

Appointment.table_description: The table manages appointment details including participants and timings.
